column2: Now that you're loading images, let's get them moving and shaking!

First things first - let's get back to the p5.js code editor. You can load your previous sketch (if you saved it at http://editor.p5js.org), or get back to where we left off: https://editor.p5js.org/madetohack/sketches/pYObWwFD
Last time, we learned how to how to display an animated gif from the internet, and after today, you'll be able to play and pause it!
To add controls to play and pause, we'll use the play() and pause() functions.
We have stored our gif in the variable gif so we will need to call gif.play(); to play the gif, and gif.pause(); to pause the gif.
Let's map our gif.play() and gif.pause() to the mouse click.
We can do this by adding the function: function mousePressed() { (Press Enter to get a new line) gif.pause(); (Press Enter to get a new line) }
This function checks to see if the mouse button is pressed, and if it is, pauses the gif.
To restart the gif after it is paused, we can add the function: function mouseReleased() { (Press Enter to get a new line) gif.play(); (Press Enter to get a new line) }
This function checks to see if the mouse button is released and if it is, plays the gif.
Try running this sketch and watch how your mouse click controls the gif!
Now, try swapping gif.pause(); with gif.play(); Which way of controlling it do you like better?
Great job! You just learned how to control your gif with mouse clicks! Next time, we'll learn how to add tons of gifs and finish your collage!
